title: 114_s2621
content: The "Biotechnology Food Labeling Uniformity Act" may be cited as the short title. Amendments to the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act are included in the Act. The "Biotechnology Food Labeling Uniformity Act" amends Section 403 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to require labeling for food or ingredients produced from genetic engineering, with exceptions for processed foods with less than nine-tenths of 1 percent genetic engineering content, foods produced with genetically engineered vaccines, or certain processed foods. The "Biotechnology Food Labeling Uniformity Act" mandates labeling for genetically engineered food or ingredients, with exceptions for certain processed foods. Producers must label genetically engineered ingredients with the words 'genetically engineered' or 'GE' in parenthesis, or with an asterisk and a statement at the bottom of the ingredient list. The "Biotechnology Food Labeling Uniformity Act" requires labeling for genetically engineered food or ingredients. Producers must label genetically engineered ingredients with a statement or symbol established by the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The "Biotechnology Food Labeling Uniformity Act" mandates labeling for genetically engineered food or ingredients, complying with regulations set by the Secretary of Health and Human Services. Information on whether a food or ingredient is derived from genetically engineered plants or animals is considered material. The "Biotechnology Food Labeling Uniformity Act" requires labeling for genetically engineered food or ingredients, following regulations established by the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The Secretary of Health and Human Services is required to issue an interim final rule by December 31, 2016, regarding the implementation of section 403(z) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act. Proposed regulations must be issued within 18 months, including definitions and updates as needed. Final regulations are to be issued within 24 months of the Act's enactment. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will issue final regulations as required by the Act. SEC. 4. FEDERAL PREEMPTION. No State or political subdivision can impose additional requirements on genetically engineered food labeling covered by this Act. The Act does not preempt a State's authority to enforce labeling laws not covered in subsection (a) or affect common law or statutory causes of action. The Act does not preempt State or Federal common law rights or statutes creating civil relief remedies or penalties for criminal conduct.
